page.title: 05HORLICKS DAIRY-PART 2
page.content: AFTER THE MILK HAS BEEN CHECKED FOR ANY FAULTS,IT IS TAKEN ACROSS THE YARD. IT IS PUT INTO MACHINES.THERE ARE TWO MACHINES,ONE FOR PASTEURISED MILK AND ONE FOR SKIMMED MILK. SAMPLES TAKEN OF THE MILK ACROSS TO LABOURATORY TO BE TESTED.WHEN THE MILK HAS BEEN TESTED AND PASSED AS SATISFACTORY IT WILL THEN HAVE TO BE BOTTLED.AT ONE OF THE LARGEST BOTTLING PLANTS IN THE COUNTRY. FOUR HUNDRED BOTTLES ARE FILLED IN ONE MINUTE SO FOR AN HOUR IT IS AN AVERAGE OF TWENTYFOUR THOUSAND BOTTLES ARE FILLED.THREE MILLION MILK BOTTLES A YEAR ARE USED.THE AVERAGE LIFE OF A MILK BOTTLE WILL BE 21 TRIPS.THE BOTTLED MILK IS SOLD THROUGHOUT THE AREA AND ALSO TAKEN BY ROAD TO LONDON. ROOKSBRIDGE DAIRY ALSO PRODUCES FOUR TYPES OF CREAM.ONLY THE WEST COUNTRY DAIRIES PRODUCE CLOTTED CREAM.
